title: Introducing: Tau Tau
content:
Is chillwave dead? Was it ever alive? This debut EP from New York’s Tau Tau may well fit the ethereal, lo-fi stereotype that many chillwave artists are unfairly branded with, yet it’s the pop capabilities within the four tracks that really elevate it above the mundane.

The minimal, trance inspired beat on Serum (Intro) provokes comparisons to Blake or Jamie Woon, whilst keeping the production down to it’s bare bones.

EP highlight Preparing A Three Course Meal For A Buddhist Monk is very much in a similar vein to the likes of Toro y Moi and Neon Indian; finding the vocals injected with plenty of reverb. However, where Tau Tau stakes his own ground, his through his intelligent lyricism, with lines like ‘ But mostly, I wish they wouldn’t talk so loudly at night‘ really striking a nerve. Comparisons can also be made to other bedroom producers (sonically that’s how it comes across), with the likes of Dimes Make Dollars and ORIG∆MI immediately coming to mind. With these four tracks, Tau Tau has ear-marked his/their music as a one to keep an ear out for in 2012, and I for one sincerely hope that they achieve their full potential.
